description: A compounding: lick (“pass one’s tongue over”) + spittle (“saliva”); the verb may derive by back-formation from the nominal derivation lickspittling (see below).

entries.meaning: A fawning toady; a base sycophant.
examples: Synonyms: brown noser, flatterer, sycophant, toady

entries.meaning: (by extension) The practice of giving empty flattery for personal gain.

verbs.description: lickspittle (third-person singular simple present lickspittles, present participle lickspittling, simple past and past participle lickspittled)

entries.meaning: (transitive and intransitive) To play the toady; take the role of a lickspittle to please (someone).
